intro: Polycarpon tetraphyllum subsp. colomense, commonly known as the Colomé's four-leafed knotweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of South America. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. The plant features a basal rosette of lanceolate, hairy leaves that are arranged in a compact cluster. Its flowering stems bear small, clustered white or pale pink flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. The subspecies is characterized by its unique leaf morphology and habitat preferences, making it a distinctive member of the Polygonaceae family.
